item.title: Array and Strings
item.description: Ref: https://leetcode.com/explore/interview/card/leetcodes-interview-crash-course-data-structures-and-algorithms 1. Arrays C++ require you to specify the size and data type of the array during initialization but also have support for lists (like std::vector in C++). 2. Strings Strings are implemented differently between languages. In Python and Java, they are immutable. In C++, they are mutable. Mutable or immutable? If you have a mutable array arr = [“a”, “b”, “c”] and an immutable string s = “abc”, but you want to instead represent “abd”, you can easily do arr[2] = “d”, but you cannot do s[2] = “d”.
